page.title: 17TRANSPORT
page.content: {ROAD, RAIL, AIR. { {ROAD :}OVER 90% OF OUR TRANSPORT IS BY ROAD. VERY FEW PEOPLE TRAVEL BY BICYCLE. PUBLIC BUS SERVICES ARE VERY GOOD FOR LOCAL AND LONG-DISTANCE TRAVEL. THE CAR IS THE MOST POPULAR MEANS OF TRANSPORT. ROADS ARE INCREASINGLY IN NEED OF REPAIR. {RAIL :}THERE ARE NO RAILWAY STATIONS IN OUR AREA. HOWEVER, THERE IS A MAIN LINE STATION APPROXIMATELY 4 KM AWAY ALLOWING INTER-CITY TRAVEL WITHIN AND OUTSIDE SCOTLAND. { {AIR :}OUR ONE SMALL AIRFIELD OPENED IN 1964 WAS RECENTLY RESURFACED AND REALIGNED TO BECOME"FIFE AIRPORT" AND CATER FOR INCREASING BUSINESS TRAFFIC, THOUGH STILL ONLY FOR SMALL AIRCRAFT. THE NEAREST MAIN AIRPORT IS IN EDINBURGH(APPROXIMATELY 50 KM AWAY).
